action: I want to safely store, search, and share business-related contracts, specifications, and internal documents
reason: To prevent document loss and mis-sharing, and to balance operational efficiency with information security
acceptance_criteria: Document upload is only possible for authenticated users.
Document viewing permissions are controlled by role and folder permissions.
Document IDs are automatically numbered and unique.
Supported file formats for upload are restricted (e.g., PDF, DOCX, XLSX).
A maximum file size limit is set.
Upload fails if the size limit is exceeded.
Virus scanning is executed during upload.
Files that fail the scan are not stored.
Files are stored in encrypted storage.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
Document metadata (creator, creation date, update date) is stored.
Document versioning is supported.
Old versions are saved as history upon new uploads.
Updater and timestamp are recorded in the version history.
A document search function exists.
Search criteria can be filtered by file name, tags, creator, and period.
SQL injection countermeasures are implemented.
Document titles and descriptions are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Document sharing links are issued with timed tokens.
Links with expired tokens are invalid.
Sharing links can be set to view-only mode.
Download history is stored.
History includes user_id, document_id, and timestamp.
Document deletion is implemented as a logical delete.
Deletion operations are stored in the audit log.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
Internal storage information is not included in the API response.
Successful document upload logs are stored.
Failed document upload logs are stored.
File processing is handled via asynchronous processing.
Automatic retry occurs upon processing failure.
An error log is recorded after three failures.
Storage processes subject to SLA monitoring can be configured.
SLA violations are integrated with the alert notification function.
A document template management function exists.
Template change history is maintained.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Document data is included in backups.
Error logs are stored upon backup failure.
